Posts.Content: I recently read the article you quoted and am awaiting confirmation of A Fish/NEU test to tell me if I am HER2 positive. Did you end up having chemo? I am terrified of it and also of Herception. And of tamoxifen. I hope you're still around on this site.
Posts.Title: Triple positive - is chemo necessary?

Posts.Content: I found out today that it's Her2 positive. I'm devastated. I'm 65 and I thought I would have some more good years.
Posts.Title: Triple positive - is chemo necessary?

Posts.Content: I'm not triple negative - I responded to a posting that was about being triple positive but apparently that posting was in the wrong group.   I'm waiting to hear if I am indeed triple positive like you.  I'm highly ER+ with a  K1-67 of 25% and an equivocal IHC test.  My FISH/NEU test has not come back yet and I"m dreading the results.  I haven't had surgery yet.  My tumor is 1.4 centimeters, grade 2.
Posts.Title: Triple positive - is chemo necessary?
